newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL -- Intel surge extended. [CORRECTED 15:30 GMT]
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL -- Intel surge extended. [CORRECTED 15:30 GMT]

text.p: Intel Corp shares continued their torrid climb early Thursday, rising to 140 in vigorous pre-open activity, a new all-time high, from 136-7/8 at last night's close.
Yesterday, Intel finished with a 7-3/4 gain.
Traders said the buying was a continuation of yesterday's rally, which is expected to continue across much of the technology sector when regular-session trade commences.
Also, Prudential Securities raised its Intel 1996 (Corrects from 1997) earnings estimate, a move traders said was helping to stoke the Intel ascent.
Microsoft Corp too added onto yesterday's gains, rising 1-5/8 to 85 before the market open, breaking through the prior year-high 84-1/2.
In the prior session, Microsoft climbed 1-1/2.
International Business Machines also rose, up 7/8 to 157.
Elsewhee, Dell Computer Corp added 2-1/8 to 62, Sun Microsystems was up one to 31-1/2, Oracle was better by 3/4 to 48 and Applied Materials rose to 39-1/2 from 38-3/8.
3Com Corp climbed to 79-1/2 from 78-7/8, U.S. Robotics Corp rose to 76-1/4 from 74-5/8 and Cisco Systems added 5/8 at 68-5/8.
